    • Field Detail

      • object

        public Gtk.GtkObject object
        The object structure needs to be the first element in the widget structure in order for the object mechanism to work correctly. This allows a GtkWidget pointer to be cast to a GtkObject pointer.

      • private_flags

        public short private_flags
        16 bits of internally used private flags. this will be packed into the same 4 byte alignment frame that state and saved_state go. we therefore don't waste any new space on this.

      • state

        public byte state
        The state of the widget. There are actually only 5 widget states (defined in "gtkenums.h").

      • saved_state

        public byte saved_state
        The saved state of the widget. When a widget's state is changed to GTK_STATE_INSENSITIVE via "gtk_widget_set_state" or "gtk_widget_set_sensitive" the old state is kept around in this field. The state will be restored once the widget gets sensitive again.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        The widget's name. If the widget does not have a name (the name is NULL), then its name (as returned by "gtk_widget_get_name") is its class's name. Among other things, the widget name is used to determine the style to use for a widget.

      • style

        public com.sun.jna.Pointer style
        The style for the widget. The style contains the colors the widget should be drawn in for each state along with graphics contexts used to draw with and the font to use for text.

      • requisition

        public Gtk.GtkRequisition requisition
        The widget's desired size.

      • allocation

        public Gtk.GtkAllocation allocation
        The widget's allocated size.

      • window

        public Gdk.GdkWindow window
        The widget's window or its parent window if it does not have a window. (Which will be indicated by the GTK_NO_WINDOW flag being set).

      • parent

        public com.sun.jna.Pointer parent
        The widget's parent.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gtk.GtkWidget

        public Gtk.GtkWidget()
